page.title: 01General Description
page.content: Our twelve kilometre square D-block included a part of Acle village and North Burlingham. The land was mostly used for growing crops. The{main crops}were sugar-beet,peas and barley or wheat. Two fields were also planted with potatoes. There was a main{road}running between Norwich and Gt.Yarmouth. There were a few minor back roads and dusty tracks leading to farms and barns. There were several{farms}in our block and we looked at four: King's Close Farm, Trunk Hill Farm, Coxhill Farm and Newport Farm.Newport, King's Close and Coxhill were all in good condition. We thought Trunk Hill Farm was quite scruffy. There were two main{tree} plantations. One was near Newport Farm and the other near Trunk Hill.
